title: Drawing, "Organ loft"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Situated in a huge niche, with a coffered conch above the entablature. Below are eleven columns in a segment supporting seemingly an entablature with ornamented frieze. Above it rise two similar ones, one somewhat shorter than the other. The central one is decorated with festoons, the upper one indistinctly. Above the central part  of the upper one rises what is seemingly a frieze. Upon it stands the pipe case, in shape of a canopy. Written in the upper right corner: "81".

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Organ loft".Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1354.
